comments:
I work whit a ConsoleLineTraker, in 3.0 for windows I launch a ciao prolog
interpreter and work fine, but whit 3.1 in linux the console not recibe the
input of the proces fine. The process output for example "Ciao 1.13 #0: lun ago
22 17:11:59 ART 2005\n?-" and the input of the console (given whit a prenotifier
appended to your document) is "Ciao 1.13 #0: lun ago 22 17:11:59 ART 2005\n\n"
the line can't ?-.
I try to test it launching my process some an external tool whit the same result.
In windows happend a similar situation whit 3.1. 
This is the output in a linux terminal:
[jvanrell@m104 ~]$ ciao
Ciao 1.13 #0: lun ago 22 17:11:59 ART 2005
?-

and this some external tool in eclipse:
Ciao 1.13 #0: lun ago 22 17:11:59 ART 2005

The process ciao is interactive, and I try to excecute others options whidout
good result, there is the eclipse log for the errors
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-09-13 03:26:45.987
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Match Job".
!STACK 0

Juan Angel Vanrell
The NPE is not coming from Eclipse. Why do you think this is an Eclipse bug?

(In reply to comment #1)
> The NPE is not coming from Eclipse. Why do you think this is an Eclipse bug?

Because in windows works fine, and not in linux.
And if the console of Linux write all of input and the eclipse console don't I
think that this is a eclipse problem.

Since we don't have your code, we do not know what is causing the NPE. As long 
as we are passing you a non-null IRegion, then there is nothing "wrong" 
happening from the Eclipse end. You'll need to provide more details to convice 
us that this is an Eclipse bug.

The problem don`t exist in 3.0 version of eclipse for Windows, my plugin work
fine in this version, but when I excecute my plugin in 3.1 in windows the
console don`t work fine, the same problem exist in the linux versions. 

The logs that I put in the other mesagges don?t have relation, whit this. Sorry

We still need to know what is "null" to cause the NPE. As far as we know, we 
do not pass a null region, so what object is null in your use case that causes 
the NPE?

Won't fix without test case. We believe we are passing a non-null region and 
that this error is in client code.
